result.purpose: This project is a wallet manager for blockchain applications, facilitating user account management, transaction handling, and integration with decentralized applications (dApps). It provides a secure environment for managing user preferences, announcements, and device interactions while leveraging external services like Moonpay and Binance.
result.architecture: The project follows a modular architecture pattern, utilizing a microservices approach with separate packages for handling different functionalities such as user management, announcements, device services, and external integrations. It employs a repository pattern for data access and uses the Echo framework for HTTP routing.

.github.purpose: Contains templates and configurations for GitHub workflows, including pull request templates.
.github.architecture: The folder follows a simple structure focused on providing templates for GitHub interactions, promoting consistency in contributions.

.github/pull_request_template.md.purpose: Template for pull requests to outline changes and checklist items.

.github/workflows.purpose: This folder is responsible for defining GitHub Actions workflows for various automation tasks related to security checks, Dockerization, linting, and release management.
.github/workflows.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern where each workflow file is responsible for a specific automation task, allowing for easy maintenance and scalability.

.github/workflows/check.yml.purpose: Defines a GitHub Actions workflow for security checks and builds on pull requests to the develop branch.
side_effects: Triggers a security scan on pull requests
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information in workflows

.github/workflows/dockerize.yml.purpose: Defines a GitHub Actions workflow for Dockerizing a mobile wallet manager.

.github/workflows/golangci-lint.yml.purpose: Configuration file for golangci-lint GitHub Actions workflow

.github/workflows/sentry.yml.purpose: Defines a GitHub Actions workflow for Sentry release management.

cmd/app.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for setting up and running the main application, including an HTTP server and a metrics server.
cmd/app.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, where the main application logic is encapsulated in a single entry point (main.go) that initializes and manages various components such as HTTP and metrics servers.

cmd/app/main.go.purpose: This file sets up an HTTP server and a metrics server, handling graceful shutdown and middleware integration.
side_effects: Initializes Sentry for error tracking if enabled
Starts HTTP and metrics servers
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information in logs if not properly configured
Dependency on external services (e.g., Sentry) for error tracking

cmd/clean_cronjob.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for implementing a command-line application that cleans old cron jobs related to announcements.
cmd/clean_cronjob.architecture: The folder follows a command-line application architecture pattern, utilizing Go's concurrency and dependency injection to manage services and database connections.

cmd/clean_cronjob/main.go.purpose: This file implements a command-line application that cleans old cron jobs related to announcements.
side_effects: Initializes Sentry for error tracking
Connects to PostgreSQL and Redis databases
Logs information and errors during execution
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive configuration data if not handled properly
Error handling may not cover all edge cases

cmd/clean_highlight_dapps.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for cleaning expired highlights from a database through a command-line application.
cmd/clean_highlight_dapps.architecture: The folder follows a command-line application architecture, utilizing a main function to initialize services and handle database interactions.

cmd/clean_highlight_dapps/main.go.purpose: This file contains the main function for a command-line application that cleans expired highlights from a database.
side_effects: Initializes Sentry for error tracking
Connects to PostgreSQL database
Connects to Redis database
Cleans expired highlights from the database
risks: Potential failure in Sentry initialization
Database connection failures
Error handling for cleaning highlights may not be comprehensive

cmd/clean_old_special_offers.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for cleaning old special offers from a database based on a specified time period.
cmd/clean_old_special_offers.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, encapsulating the functionality to clean old special offers within a single executable Go program, leveraging dependency injection for database and configuration management.

cmd/clean_old_special_offers/main.go.purpose: This file contains a program that cleans old special offers from a database based on a specified time period.
side_effects: Initializes Sentry for error tracking
Connects to a PostgreSQL database
Clears old special offers from the database
risks: Potential database connection failure
Error handling may not cover all edge cases
Sentry initialization failure could lead to untracked errors

cmd/ip_location.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for initializing a Sentry client for error tracking and downloading a new IP location database using Redis.
cmd/ip_location.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, focusing on initializing services and handling dependencies for error tracking and database management.

cmd/ip_location/main.go.purpose: This file initializes a Sentry client for error tracking and downloads a new IP location database using Redis.
side_effects: Initializes Sentry for error tracking
Logs errors and process time
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information in logs
Dependency on external services (Sentry, Redis)

cmd/trigger_announcement.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for triggering announcements in the application.
cmd/trigger_announcement.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, encapsulating the functionality related to triggering announcements and managing dependencies through service and repository layers.

cmd/trigger_announcement/main.go.purpose: This file is the main entry point for triggering announcements in the application.
side_effects: Initializes Sentry for error tracking
Connects to a PostgreSQL database
Triggers an announcement based on environment variable
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information through environment variables
Error handling may not cover all failure cases

config.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for defining and managing application configuration settings.
config.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, separating configuration definitions, utility functions for data handling, and unit tests for validation.

config/config.go.purpose: This file defines configuration structures and initializes application settings using viper for a service.
side_effects: Panic if the configuration file cannot be read
Sets global logging level based on configuration
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive configuration data if not handled properly

config/config.yml.purpose: Configuration file for a mobile wallet manager service, defining various settings for services, authentication, logging, and other application parameters.
risks: Exposure of sensitive information due to redacted keys and URLs
Potential for misconfiguration leading to security vulnerabilities

config/func_print.go.purpose: This file contains functions to hide sensitive data in configuration structures.
side_effects: Modifies the input data structures to hide sensitive information.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive data if the hiding logic is bypassed or fails.

config/func_print_test.go.purpose: Unit tests for functions that hide sensitive data in maps and slices.
side_effects: Prints test data to the console
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive data if not handled properly

database/redis.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for connecting to a Redis database and managing configurations for the connection.
database/redis.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, encapsulating Redis connection logic and metrics handling within a single Go file.

database/redis/redis.go.purpose: This file provides functionality to connect to a Redis database and manage configurations for the connection.
side_effects: Logs connection status to Redis server
Registers a Prometheus collector for Redis metrics
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information if credentials are logged or mishandled
Insecure TLS configuration if InsecureSkipVerify is set to true

docs.purpose: This folder is responsible for documentation and configuration related to the HTTP client settings.
docs.architecture: The folder contains a single configuration file in JSON format, indicating a simple structure with low complexity.

docs/http-client.env.json.purpose: Configuration file for HTTP client settings

handlers.purpose: Responsible for handling various operations related to accounts, announcements, devices, external authentication, and other services in a web application.
handlers.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, where each file represents a handler for specific functionalities, promoting separation of concerns and maintainability.

handlers/account.go.purpose: Handles account-related operations such as getting account info, linking accounts, refreshing tokens, and revoking tokens.
side_effects: Modifies the state of user accounts
Interacts with external services for authentication
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information if error handling is not properly managed
Security risks related to token management and storage

handlers/announcement.go.purpose: This file defines an announcement handler that manages announcements and user preferences through various internal and public API endpoints.

handlers/binance.go.purpose: This file defines a handler for signing requests using the Binance service.

handlers/blacklist.go.purpose: Handles requests related to blacklist sites and returns them in JSON format.
side_effects: Interacts with external services to retrieve blacklist sites
Returns JSON response to HTTP requests
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive data if blacklist items are not properly managed

handlers/common.go.purpose: This file defines a common handler for managing configurations and code versions in a web application.
side_effects: Modifies cache for common configurations and code versions.
Publishes events to Redis channels.
risks: Potential for race conditions due to concurrent access to shared resources.
Improper error handling may expose sensitive information.

handlers/dapp.go.purpose: This file defines a handler for managing decentralized application (DApp) operations, including saving, updating, retrieving, and deleting DApps and highlights.
side_effects: Interacts with external services for saving, updating, and retrieving DApps and highlights.
Modifies the state of the application by saving or deleting DApps and highlights.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive data if error handling is not properly managed.
Possible denial of service if the handler is overwhelmed with requests.

handlers/default.go.purpose: This file defines a handler function to retrieve agent information from the context.

handlers/device.go.purpose: Handles device-related operations such as resetting devices, registering devices, updating push tokens, syncing addresses, and importing wallets.
side_effects: Logs information about device resets
Asynchronously initializes device registration if not ignoring existing devices
risks: Potential for race conditions in asynchronous operations
Improper error handling could lead to unhandled exceptions

handlers/external_auth.go.purpose: Handles external authentication processes, including exchanging auth codes and revoking tokens.

handlers/locationhandler.go.purpose: Handles location-related requests and responses for a web service.
side_effects: Logs debug information when looking up location
risks: Potential exposure of internal service endpoints if not properly secured
Potential for error handling issues if external service fails
Improper validation of input could lead to security vulnerabilities

handlers/network.go.purpose: This file defines a network handler for managing network-related operations in a web application.
side_effects: Modifies cache for DApps and contracts based on user agent and filters.

handlers/releasecandidate.go.purpose: Handles release candidate features and configurations for a web service.

handlers/trusted_domain.go.purpose: Handles trusted domain operations including retrieval, saving, and deletion of trusted domains.
side_effects: Modifies the state of trusted domains in the database.
Interacts with external services for blacklist checks.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive domain information.
Improper validation may lead to security vulnerabilities.

httpclient.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for defining various HTTP clients for interacting with different APIs and managing device-related operations.
httpclient.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, where each file encapsulates a specific client or functionality related to HTTP operations, promoting separation of concerns and reusability.

httpclient/athena.go.purpose: This file defines an HTTP client for linking accounts using the Athena API.

httpclient/device.go.purpose: This file defines a DeviceClient interface and its implementation for managing device-related operations via HTTP requests.
side_effects: Logs warnings for not registered devices during address sync
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information if SecretKey is not handled properly

httpclient/internal_client.go.purpose: This file implements an internal HTTP client with HMAC authentication for making requests to a specified URL.
side_effects: Logs request details and errors
Modifies HTTP request headers
risks: Potential exposure of SecretKey if not handled properly
Error handling may expose sensitive information in logs

httpclient/mercury.go.purpose: This file defines a MercuryClient interface and its implementation for sending notifications via HTTP.
side_effects: Logs errors when marshaling JSON or creating HTTP requests.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information in logs if errors occur.

httpclient/tracking.go.purpose: Provides a client for tracking requests asynchronously and synchronously.
side_effects: Sends HTTP requests to a tracking server
risks: Potential exposure of API key in logs or errors

middleware.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for implementing various middleware functions for an Echo web server application, including error handling, authentication, request tracking, and user agent parsing.
middleware.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, where each middleware file encapsulates specific functionality and can be independently used within the Echo web framework.

middleware/custom_requests_total_prometh.purpose: This file defines middleware for tracking custom HTTP requests using Prometheus metrics.
side_effects: Registers a new Prometheus counter metric
Logs fatal error if registration fails
risks: Potential logging of sensitive user agent information

middleware/error_handler.go.purpose: Handles errors globally for an Echo web server application.
side_effects: Logs error details to the context's logger
Sends JSON response with error details to the client
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive error details in logs
Improper handling of JWT errors may lead to unauthorized access

middleware/internal_auth.go.purpose: This file implements HMAC authentication middleware for validating HMAC signatures in HTTP requests.
side_effects: Modifies HTTP request handling based on HMAC validation
risks: Potential for unauthorized access if HMAC validation fails
Improper handling of errors may expose sensitive information

middleware/network_api_v1_checking.go.purpose: Defines a middleware function to check if the API version is v1 and sets a context key accordingly.
side_effects: Sets a context key in the echo.Context

middleware/tracking_internal_api.go.purpose: Defines a middleware for tracking API requests in an Echo web framework application.
side_effects: Asynchronously tracks API request data.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive request data in tracking logs.

middleware/user_agent_parsing.go.purpose: This file provides middleware for parsing user agent strings in a web application.
side_effects: Modifies the context with parsed user agent information

middleware/wallet_auth.go.purpose: Middleware for verifying wallet signatures in HTTP requests.
side_effects: Logs request information
risks: Potential for unauthorized access if wallet addresses are not properly whitelisted
Signature validation failures may expose sensitive information

migrations.purpose: This folder contains SQL migration scripts responsible for setting up and modifying the database schema for a blockchain-related application.
migrations.architecture: The folder follows a sequential migration pattern where each file represents a specific change to the database schema, allowing for version control and rollback capabilities.

migrations/20230407150000_init.sql.purpose: This file contains SQL commands to set up database schema and initial data for a blockchain-related application.
side_effects: Modifies the database schema by creating tables and types.
Inserts initial data into the tables.
risks: Potential SQL injection if user inputs are not properly sanitized.
Data integrity risks if foreign key constraints are not enforced.

migrations/20231005150000_add_announceme.purpose: This file contains database migration scripts to create and drop tables related to announcements, special offers, and user preferences.
side_effects: Creates tables and indexes in the database
Modifies the database schema
risks: Potential data loss when dropping tables
Foreign key constraints may lead to errors if referenced data exists

migrations/20240111120000_alter_preferen.purpose: This file contains migration scripts to alter the preferences table in a database.
side_effects: Modifies the database schema
Changes default values
Creates and drops constraints
risks: Potential data loss during DELETE operation
Risk of violating unique constraints if not handled properly

migrations/20240206110000_add_trusted_do.purpose: This file contains database migration scripts to create and drop tables related to trusted domains and quick access D apps.
side_effects: Creates tables in the database
Indexes the quick_access_d_apps table

migrations/20240410140000_add_dapp_highl.purpose: This file contains database migration scripts to modify the schema of a PostgreSQL database.
side_effects: Modifies the database schema
Creates new tables and indexes
risks: Potential data loss if not properly backed up before migration

migrations/20240808130000_alter_preferen.purpose: This file contains migration scripts to create and drop an index on the preferences table.
side_effects: Modifies the database schema by adding or removing an index.
risks: Potential performance impact on the database during index creation or deletion.

models.purpose: Defines data structures and models for various components of the application, including user management, announcements, devices, contracts, and notifications.
models.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, where each file defines specific data models and structures related to different functionalities of the application.

models/account.go.purpose: Defines request and response structures for user information and token management in an authentication system.

models/announcement.go.purpose: Defines models and structures for handling announcements and related data.
side_effects: Logs errors when JSON unmarshalling fails in ToAnnouncement methods.

models/app.go.purpose: Defines data structures for managing code versioning and update requests.

models/binance.go.purpose: Defines data structures for signing requests and responses for Binance.

models/blacklist.go.purpose: Defines a request structure for getting blacklist sites.

models/chain.go.purpose: Defines a configuration structure for a blockchain chain model.

models/common.go.purpose: Defines data models for common structures used in the application.

models/contract.go.purpose: Defines data structures and methods for handling smart contract information and metadata.

models/default.go.purpose: Defines data structures and methods for handling responses and pagination.

models/device.go.purpose: Defines data structures for device management and requests related to devices.

models/external_auth.go.purpose: Defines data structures for handling external authentication requests and responses.

models/highlight.go.purpose: Defines data models and request/response structures for highlights in an application.

models/ip_locations.go.purpose: Defines data structures for IP location information and request handling.

models/moonpay.go.purpose: Defines data structures for Moonpay signing requests and responses.

models/network.go.purpose: Defines the Network model and related request structures for managing blockchain network data.

models/notification.go.purpose: Defines data structures and constants for managing push notifications and their recipients.

models/preference.go.purpose: Defines data models for user preferences and filters related to device preferences.

models/quickaccess.go.purpose: Defines data structures and methods for managing quick access decentralized applications (DApps).

models/ref_code.go.purpose: Defines data models and filters for managing referral codes and wallets.

models/releasecandidate.go.purpose: Defines request structures for feature management in a device context.

models/trusted_domain.go.purpose: Defines data structures and methods for managing trusted domains in an application.

models/useragent.go.purpose: Defines a structure for user agent information and provides a method to check if the agent information is empty.

pkg/announcement.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for managing announcements, including scheduling and retrieving them.
pkg/announcement.architecture: The folder follows a service-oriented architecture pattern, encapsulating the logic for announcements in dedicated service and configuration files.

pkg/announcement/announcement_svc.go.purpose: This file defines a service for managing announcements, including scheduling and retrieving them.
side_effects: Uploads images to GCS
Deletes images from GCS on error
risks: Potential for file upload vulnerabilities
Improper handling of image types may lead to security issues

pkg/announcement/config.go.purpose: Defines configuration structures for an announcement service, including communication, storage, and Kubernetes settings.

pkg/binance.purpose: Handles configuration and service for signing payloads using ECDSA for Binance.
pkg/binance.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, separating configuration and service logic into distinct files.

pkg/binance/config.go.purpose: Defines a configuration structure for Binance with a private key.

pkg/binance/service.go.purpose: Provides a service for signing payloads using ECDSA.
side_effects: Generates a cryptographic signature
Encodes signature in base64
risks: Potential exposure of private key if not handled securely

pkg/blacklist.purpose: Responsible for managing blacklisted sites and feature flags based on user agent information.
pkg/blacklist.architecture: The folder follows a service-oriented architecture pattern, encapsulating configuration and service logic for blacklist management.

pkg/blacklist/config.go.purpose: Defines configuration structures for a blacklist feature.

pkg/blacklist/service.go.purpose: Provides a service interface for managing blacklisted sites and feature flags based on user agent information.

pkg/crypto/hmac.purpose: Responsible for HMAC (Hash-based Message Authentication Code) functionalities including signing, validation, and configuration.
pkg/crypto/hmac.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, encapsulating HMAC functionalities in separate files for configuration, signing, validation, and testing, promoting separation of concerns.

pkg/crypto/hmac/config.go.purpose: Defines a configuration structure for HMAC with normalization of whitelist addresses.
side_effects: Modifies the WhitelistAddresses field of the Config struct.

pkg/crypto/hmac/funcs.go.purpose: Provides HMAC signing functions using SHA256 and SHA512 algorithms.
risks: Potential for cryptographic vulnerabilities if used improperly.

pkg/crypto/hmac/funcs_test.go.purpose: Unit tests for the HMAC signing functionality.

pkg/crypto/hmac/hmac.go.purpose: Provides HMAC validation functionality including signature verification and clock skew validation.
side_effects: Prints error messages to console if parsing time fails
risks: Potential for time manipulation attacks if clock skew is not properly validated

pkg/crypto/hmac/hmac_test.go.purpose: Unit tests for HMAC validation functions, checking clock skew and signature validation.

pkg/crypto/hmac/init.go.purpose: This file initializes a singleton instance of the HMAC structure with a configuration.
side_effects: Initializes a singleton instance of HMAC
Modifies global variable HConfig
risks: Potential race conditions if InitInstance is called concurrently without proper synchronization

pkg/dapp.purpose: Responsible for managing quick access decentralized applications (dApps) and their highlights, including CRUD operations and caching mechanisms.
pkg/dapp.architecture: The folder follows a service-oriented architecture pattern, encapsulating configuration and service logic for dApps.

pkg/dapp/config.go.purpose: Defines a configuration structure for dapp with a limit for highlighted dapps.

pkg/dapp/d_app_svc.go.purpose: This file defines a service for managing quick access decentralized applications (dApps) and highlights, including CRUD operations and caching mechanisms.
side_effects: Publishing messages to refresh cache asynchronously

pkg/device.purpose: Responsible for managing device-related services and configurations.
pkg/device.architecture: The folder follows a service-oriented architecture, encapsulating device management functionalities and configurations in separate files.

pkg/device/config.go.purpose: Defines configuration structures for device services.

pkg/device/service.go.purpose: Provides a service for managing devices, including operations like getting, resetting, and creating devices.

pkg/gcs.architecture: The folder follows a service-oriented architecture, encapsulating the configuration and service logic for Google Cloud Storage interactions.

pkg/gcs/config.go.purpose: Defines a configuration structure for Google Cloud Storage.

pkg/gcs/service.go.purpose: Provides a service for uploading, deleting, and downloading files to/from Google Cloud Storage.
side_effects: Interacts with Google Cloud Storage API
Logs fatal errors
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive data if file URLs are not properly secured
Error handling may not cover all edge cases

pkg/helper.purpose: Provides various helper functions for encryption, file handling, token generation, and utility operations.
pkg/helper.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, where each file encapsulates specific functionalities related to helper operations, promoting code reusability and separation of concerns.

pkg/helper/aes.go.purpose: Provides helper functions for AES encryption.
side_effects: Generates random initialization vector (IV)
Encodes output in base64
risks: Potential for weak keys if user input is not validated
Sensitive data exposure if not handled properly

pkg/helper/binder.go.purpose: This file provides helper functions for binding multipart file uploads in an Echo web framework context.
side_effects: Modifies the input struct by binding file headers from the HTTP request context.
risks: Potential for reflection-based errors if the input type is not a struct pointer.

pkg/helper/hmac_token.go.purpose: Generates an HMAC access token for authentication purposes.

pkg/helper/pointer.go.purpose: Defines a generic function to create a pointer to a value of any type.

pkg/helper/random.go.purpose: Generates a random string of specified length using alphanumeric characters.
risks: Potential for cryptographic weaknesses if not used properly.

pkg/helper/ronin.go.purpose: Provides utility functions for normalizing Ethereum addresses, hashing messages, and validating signatures.
risks: Potential for signature forgery if not properly validated

pkg/helper/slice.go.purpose: Provides utility functions for manipulating slices, including filtering, finding index, converting slices to maps, and mapping elements.

pkg/helper/tls.go.purpose: This file provides a function to convert certificate and key data into a TLS configuration.

pkg/location.purpose: Responsible for managing IP location data and providing services related to it.
pkg/location.architecture: The folder follows a service-oriented architecture pattern, encapsulating configuration and service logic for IP location management.

pkg/location/config.go.purpose: Defines a configuration structure for the application, including database URLs and file names.

pkg/location/location_svc.go.purpose: Provides a service for retrieving IP location data and managing the database of such data.
side_effects: Creates and deletes files on the filesystem.
Makes HTTP requests to download data.

pkg/moonpay/config.go.purpose: Defines a configuration structure for Moonpay with a secret field.

pkg/moonpay/service.go.purpose: Provides a service for signing URLs using a configuration.

pkg/preference.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for managing user preferences related to a wallet application, including fetching, updating, and syncing preferences based on device and address.
pkg/preference.architecture: The folder follows a service-oriented architecture pattern, encapsulating the logic for user preference management within a dedicated service file.

pkg/preference/pref_svc.go.purpose: This file defines a service for managing user preferences related to a wallet application, including fetching, updating, and syncing preferences based on device and address.
side_effects: Logs information and errors related to device preferences and migrations.
Asynchronously migrates notification settings for devices.

Blocks on job channel until a worker is available

repositories.architecture: The folder follows a repository pattern, encapsulating data access logic for different entities and providing a clean interface for database operations.

repositories/announcement.go.purpose: This file defines a repository interface and its implementation for managing announcements and special offers in a database.
side_effects: Database transactions for creating, updating, and deleting announcements and special offers.

side_effects: Database transactions are initiated and may modify the database state.
risks: Potential SQL injection if inputs are not properly sanitized.
Error handling may expose sensitive information if not managed correctly.

repositories/common.go.purpose: This file defines a repository interface and its implementation for managing common entities in a database using GORM.
side_effects: Database transactions are initiated and may modify the database state.
risks: Potential SQL injection if input is not properly sanitized.
Error handling may expose sensitive information.

repositories/contract.go.purpose: This file defines a repository interface and its implementation for managing contract data in a database.
side_effects: Database operations that modify contract data
risks: Potential SQL injection if filter conditions are not properly sanitized
Error handling may expose sensitive information

repositories/dapp.go.purpose: This file defines a repository interface and its implementation for managing decentralized applications (DApps) in a database.
side_effects: Database operations such as create, update, delete on DApps.
risks: Potential SQL injection if filter conditions are not properly sanitized.
Error handling may expose sensitive information.

repositories/highlight.go.purpose: This file defines a repository for managing highlights in a database using GORM.
side_effects: Database transactions are performed which may modify the state of the database.
risks: Potential SQL injection if inputs are not properly sanitized.
Concurrency issues if multiple transactions are not handled correctly.

repositories/init.go.purpose: Provides pagination functionality for database queries using GORM.
side_effects: Modifies database query parameters based on pagination logic

repositories/network.go.purpose: This file defines a repository interface and its implementation for managing network entities in a database.
side_effects: Database transactions are initiated and may modify the database state.
risks: Potential SQL injection if filter conditions are not properly sanitized.
Panic in SaveNetwork, UpdateNetworks, and SaveNetworks if not implemented.

repositories/preference.go.purpose: This file defines a repository for managing user preferences in a database using GORM.
side_effects: Database operations such as create, update, delete, and query.
risks: Potential SQL injection if user input is not properly sanitized.
Error handling may expose sensitive information.

repositories/quickaccess.go.purpose: This file defines a repository for managing Quick Access DApps, including CRUD operations and search functionality.
side_effects: Database transactions are performed which may modify the state of the database.
risks: Potential SQL injection if user input is not properly sanitized in search queries.

repositories/trusted_domain.go.purpose: This file defines a repository for managing trusted domains in a database using GORM.
side_effects: Database transactions are initiated and may modify the database state.
risks: Potential SQL injection if user input is not properly sanitized in queries.

root.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for the wallet-manager project, including configuration, documentation, and service definitions.
root.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, organizing configuration, documentation, and service definitions for a Dockerized application.

.golangci.yaml.purpose: Configuration file for GolangCI-Lint, specifying linting rules and settings for Go projects.

SECURITY.md.purpose: Documentation of the security policy for the project, including supported versions and vulnerability reporting.

country_iso2_to_currency.json.purpose: This file maps country ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes to their respective currencies.

country_iso2_to_iso3.json.purpose: This file maps ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country codes to ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 country codes.

docker-compose.yml.purpose: Defines services for a Docker application including PostgreSQL and Redis.
side_effects: Creates Docker containers for PostgreSQL and Redis services.
risks: Exposing database ports may lead to unauthorized access if not properly secured.

entrypoint.sh.purpose: This script serves as an entry point to run a service application.
side_effects: Executes an external application './app' with passed arguments.
risks: Potential execution of untrusted code if './app' is not secure.

routes.purpose: Responsible for setting up and managing routes for an Echo web server, including public, private, and internal API endpoints for a wallet manager application.
routes.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, organizing routes into separate files for public, private, and internal APIs, each handling specific functionalities and utilizing Echo framework for HTTP routing.

routes/init.go.purpose: Sets up routes for an Echo web server, initializes database clients, and registers handlers for various services.
side_effects: Establishes connections to PostgreSQL and Redis databases
Logs fatal errors if database connections fail
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive configuration data if not properly secured
Dependency on external services (e.g., Redis, PostgreSQL) may lead to failures if those services are down

routes/internal.go.purpose: Defines internal routes for a wallet manager API, handling various network and announcement functionalities.
side_effects: Modifies the state of the API by registering routes and handlers.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive data if routes are not properly secured.

routes/private.go.purpose: Defines routes for private wallet management functionalities in an Echo web server.
side_effects: Creates HTTP routes for handling wallet management requests.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive wallet management operations if not properly secured.

routes/public.go.purpose: Defines public API routes for a wallet manager application, including health checks and various resource endpoints.
side_effects: Modifies the state of the application by registering routes and handlers.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information through API endpoints if not properly secured.
Dependency on external packages may introduce vulnerabilities.

tests.purpose: This folder contains tests for the web server that provides an endpoint to sign messages using ECDSA.
tests.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, focusing on the implementation of a web server with clear separation of concerns for handling requests and signing messages.

tests/main.go.purpose: This file implements a web server that provides an endpoint to sign messages using ECDSA.
side_effects: Starts an HTTP server
Listens for OS interrupt signals to gracefully shut down
risks: Potential exposure of private keys if not handled securely
Logging sensitive information (e.g., errors) could lead to information leakage
